main event: On September 6, 1955, multiple witnesses, including airline pilots and ground observers, reported sightings of a bright bluish object with a white flash and a blue-white exhaust flame traveling at high speeds before exploding with a blinding flash of light.
interesting points: The object's sighting was reported by different flight crews of Colonial Airlines and observed from both the air and ground at different locations.
The description of the object, its movement, and its explosion led the investigating officers to consider the possibility of it being a celestial phenomenon or a fireball exploding in the atmosphere.
Witnesses described the object as a bright bluish flash in the sky, with a bluish-white exhaust and changing colors, which lasted for a few seconds before disappearing behind the trees.

There were multiple reports of the object's sighting, and follow-up investigative efforts included checking with various agencies and individuals who might have observed the same or similar phenomena.
The reports indicate the high speed of the object, estimated to be four or five times the speed of a jet aircraft, and its sudden appearance without any prior trace in the sky.
sighted object: bright bluish object with a white flash and a blue-white exhaust flame
witnesses: Multiple witnesses including airline pilots and ground observers
photographs: No photographs were included in the report
